NPCForge.PodpowiedzUstawienia:
To get started, you MUST create two empty compendiums: one for archetypes and one for races. Then set the compendiums used for Skills, Edges, Hindrances, Powers, and Gear. Without this, the generator WILL NOT WORK.

If you added new compendiums while Foundry was already running, refresh the page (F5) to update the list.
This module doesn’t modify the content of compendiums, but to function properly, editing must be enabled for them.

For details, join my Discord channel.

NPCForge.BronNaturalnaInfo: The Natural Weapons field is optional. In most cases, it’s enough to use the same compendium as for Gear.
NPCForge.UstawieniaPodpowiedz: Configure the compendiums used for character generation.
NPCForge.InfoRasaKarta:
This is an ancient racial scroll, crafted by the mighty NPC Forge Constructor.
It doesn't cast anything, doesn't trigger powers, and dragging it onto a character sheet won’t do squat – except maybe make the Constructor’s interface itch.
The secrets within are hidden from mortal eyes – available only to those brave enough to use console.log().
You can overwrite the description with your own race flavor text, but don’t bother adding spells (Active Effects) or magic items (Item Grants) – the Constructor already handles them… possibly twice.
NPCForge.InfoArchetypKarta: The archetype – the heart of the character creation process, the soul of the Constructor… and afterwards, kind of a keepsake, kind of digital litter. Its only remaining purpose is to grant items (Item Grants) – like starting weapons, armor, abilities, shiny baubles. Other than that? Keep it. Toss it. The Constructor no longer watches. But maybe it weeps quietly when it realizes you’ve moved on.
NPCForge.ZasadyLosowaniaOpis: Each character type uses a dedicated preset. Here, you can configure how many points the generator will spend on attributes, skills, and edges. Max die limits will prevent further increases once that value is reached. You can disable this option, as well as hindrance generation. Enabling advancement rules means the character won’t gain skills higher than their governing attribute, and won’t get edges unless the requirements for attributes and skills are met. Regardless, the generator always checks for required edges, rank, and Wild Card status. Other prerequisites are not checked. Anomalies introduce a small chance of generating an attribute outside of the racial limits. For example, a very weak human might start with Strength d4-1, making the racial maximum d10 instead of d12. Each development point grants two skills. The generator never spends double costs – it just skips unavailable options. Unused attribute points roll over to skills, and unused skill points roll into edges. At the end, invalid arcane skills (e.g. when the character has no arcane background) are removed and refunded. If points remain, another attempt of buying Skills will be made.
NPCForge.WagaElementowOpis: These weight values determine how many copies of each item are added to the random draw pool. The shown percentages represent the chance of rolling each element when there are three with different weights. The RESET button restores default values.
NPCForge.AmunicjaOpis: Enter how much ammo to add to the character sheet when a weapon is granted. Ammo must be an actual item and must exist in the same compendium as the gear used by the module. ❗ means this ammo was not found and will not be added.
NPCForge.AtrybutyOpisRasa: Define the attribute ranges for this race. Anomalies introduce a small chance of the character being unusually strong or unusually dumb. If an anomaly occurs, both min and max values of the affected attribute are shifted by a random value from 1 to the specified range. You can toggle anomalies in the generator settings. Usually, a value of 1 works best – enough to add some variation without breaking the race concept. A value of 0 disables anomalies completely. Higher values are useful for races with wide attribute variance.
NPCForge.UmiejetnosciOpisRasa: Set starting skills. ⚠️ If you skip core skills, they won’t be present on the generated actor!
NPCForge.PrzewagiOpisRasa: Add edges that should be granted automatically. You can also drag in edges from outside the chosen compendium.
NPCForge.ZawadyOpisRasa: Add hindrances that should be granted automatically. Drag-and-drop from other compendiums is also allowed.
NPCForge.MoceOpisRasa: Add powers that should be granted automatically. Reminder: the character needs Power Points to actually use these powers.
NPCForge.BronNaturalnaOpisRasa: You can optionally add a natural weapon for the race – choose from the list or drag one in. Entering a category name before adding another row filters the compendium. This also lets you add fists if you want the character to default to them. The item will be granted using the Item Grant method.
NPCForge.TabliceOpisRasa: Add any random tables that should be rolled during NPC generation. The results will be added to the description.
NPCForge.InfoRasa: Once created, the race becomes an item of type 'ancestry'. You can freely edit its description, but all the data you just entered is stored in a hidden metadata section. Dragging this item onto a character sheet does nothing. It only works inside the generator.
NPCForge.BrakNazwyRasa: You must enter a race name first!
NPCForge.PrzeciaganieBladRasa: Only Edges, Hindrances, Powers and Weapons can be dragged here.
NPCForge.AtrybutyOpisArchetyp: Set how often each attribute should be picked. First icon = skip, fifth icon = always max out. The three in the middle represent increasing frequency. This system is used across the whole builder.
NPCForge.UmiejetnosciOpisArchetyp: Set the frequency for skill selection. The icons work the same as for attributes. Skills highlighted in purple won’t be selected unless the character also rolls an edge granting ARCANE BACKGROUNDS.
NPCForge.PrzewagiOpisArchetyp: Add edges to roll. You can include them individually or group them into sets (🔖 icon), each with its own weight. If the same edge appears in multiple places, the generator uses the highest weight. You can also check 'All Edges' – this includes the entire compendium, but conflicts are resolved by using the weight from other entries. Except for NEW POWERS and POWER POINTS edges, each edge can only be rolled once. NOTE: If you have completely removed a set that was previously selected here, its contents will appear empty.
NPCForge.MoceOpisArchetyp: Same rules as for edges. Click 🧠 to open power-related options. The button on the left lets you set required arcane-related edges. NOTE: Although powers can have multiple variants, the generator won’t roll the same power twice. However, if the power comes from the race, it might appear again — since racial powers might use different variants.
NPCForge.UstawieniaMocyOpisArchetyp: Choose which edges are related to powers. The book icon means NEW POWERS, and the orb means POWER POINTS. Keep in mind: NEW POWERS and POWER POINTS edges are limited to once per rank. Arcane skills won’t be selected unless the character also rolls the appropriate arcane edge.
NPCForge.PancerzOpisArchetyp: Armor can cover multiple locations (e.g. torso and arms). The generator rolls locations in order: torso, head, arms, legs – skipping any that are already filled. Simple Mode gives the same armor across all ranks. Detailed Mode allows for rank-specific variation.
NPCForge.BronOpisArchetyp: Simple and Detailed modes work the same as for armor. You can add multiple weapon sets and decide how they are combined – separately, together, or selectively. 'OR' links mean the generator will choose one set from the linked group. 'AND' links mean one set from each linked group will be picked. Example: linking three sets as OR → AND will first pick one set from the first two, then add a second one from the third.
NPCForge.ItemGrantsOpisArchetyp: Drag in items, edges, and more (except archetypes and origins). The generator doesn’t analyze them – it simply adds them to the character via ITEM GRANTS.
NPCForge.BrakNazwyArchetypu: You must enter an archetype name first!
NPCForge.PrzeciaganieBladItemGrant: Only ITEM-type entries can be dragged here, excluding Archetype and Origin types.
NPCForge.CzyChceszUsunac: Are you sure you want to delete
NPCForge.BrakKompendiowInfo: You must configure all required compendiums in the module settings. After adding them, refresh Foundry (F5).
NPCForge.BrakNazwyLubWyboru: Cannot generate without archetype, race, and name.
NPCForge.BladUmiejetnosciGenerator: Generation stopped: skills outside the skills compendium found in item type:
NPCForge.BladPrzewagGenerator: Generation stopped: edges outside the edges compendium found in item type: archetype
NPCForge.NadprzyrodzoneOpis: Mark all edges that require an arcane-enabling edge to be picked. You can also specify which exact edge is required. ⚠️ Do NOT mark the edge that grants arcane access itself – it almost certainly shouldn’t be here.
NPCForge.OpisModyfikator: This modifier comes from the race
